Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration and Refugee Board's decision was based on speculation, cultural insensitivity, or overlooked evidence
Credibility_Assessment: Board questioned Ms. Rani's actions post-attack, doubted husband's disappearance, but overall credibility assessment upheld
Legal_Provision: Well-founded fear of persecution under IRPA
Basis_of_Claim: Threats against Shia family in Pakistan
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility of claimant and plausibility of account
Application_Error: Alleged speculation, cultural insensitivity, overlooking evidence
Assessment_Standard: Fair assessment of evidence with consideration of cultural context
Application_Factor: Consistency of testimony, plausibility of events
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule requiring fair assessment, consideration of cultural context, avoidance of unsupported speculation
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility in claimant's account
Evidentiary_Issues: Doubt cast on corroborative letters and post-incident behavior
Procedural_Fairness: Claimant had opportunity to present case; decision found procedurally fair
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in narrative, implausibility of actions post-attack
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on alleged speculation and cultural insensitivity
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada (Federal Court review of IRB decision)
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to consider cultural context and evidence fairly
Omission_Type: Failure to adequately address corroborative evidence (alleged)
